languageToPublish: Please select in which language(s) you wish to submit this record:
scientificNameInfo: The scientific name of an organism is typically composed of the name of the genus followed by its specific denomination. For example
isScientificName: is the scientific name for rice.
taxonomicClassificationInfo: The taxonomic classification is a formal designation of an organism. Example: genus:
commonNamesInfo: A common name is used to refer to an organism in everyday language and may include synonyms. Example: maize / corn.
taxonomicClassificationsInfo: Please provide a link to a record in a taxonomy database, e.g. GBIF, Catalogue of Life.
habitatInfo: Describe the type of environments where the organism may persist or proliferate (max 200 characters).
occursInNorthAmerica: occurs in North America from Alberta in the west to Quebec in the east and Florida, Texas, Arizona and northern Mexico in the south (max 200 characters).
compatibleSpeciesInfo: Provide a list of species using the taxonomic classification (genus and species names) that are known to cross-fertilize with the organism in the record.
relevantInformationInfo: Please use this field to provide any other relevant information that may not have been addressed elsewhere in the record.
relevantDocumentsInfo: Please use this field to provide any other relevant website addresses and/or one or more relevant documents that will be stored in the database for users to download
notesInfo: The “Notes” field is for personal reference and can be seen only when the record is being edited. It will be hidden once the record is published. This field is not meant to be used for confidential information.
